page.title: 13Extractive Industry-Ecology
page.content: The owner of the gravel pit is interested in preserving the wild life of the area and some landscaping has been done with 10 acres of newly planted trees - mostly conifers, while friends have been encouraged to stock the quarry pool with Tench, Perch and Roach. This in turn attracts birds like the Heron which are often seen at the water's edge. Wild flowers are allowed to bloom where they may among the piles of stones and sand, which add welcome touches of colour to a fairly drab landscape.
